data.title: Preparing for 2.1.4-stable
data.body:
Same deal as #8087, but for 2.1.4.

> This issue is meant to gather initial feedback on pre-release binaries, so that we can spot regressions (either from new developments or from bad cherry-picks I might have done).
>
> Note: as always I'm only interested in regressions (i.e. bugs that did not affect earlier 2.1.x versions), including to some extent bugs in new features if there are any. Packaging issues with the templates, etc., are of course also interesting :)

data.title: Saving a TileMap node as scene, crashes the editor
data.body:
**Ubuntu 17.04- Godot version: 2.1.2/2.1.3**

**Issue description:**
Saving a TileMap node (on the tree) as a separate scene, crashes the editor after saving (sometimes do not save).

This only happens if the TileMap is the root of the new scene, if the TileMap is child of the node saved as scene, it works.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Can be tested with demos (kinematic character, platformer).
Select a TileMap and save it as a new scene.

data.title: String does not seemed to be passed by copy when passed through a signal?
data.body:
**Windows 10. Godot 2.1.3 (official binary).**

**Steps to reproduce:**

1) Open up a new project, and switch to 2D view.

2) Make a Control node as the root of a new scene, call it "Container".

3) Make a Label node (call it "Display"), and a LineEdit node (call it "InputBar").

4) Attach the following script to InputBar:
```

extends LineEdit

signal enter_hit(input_text)

func _ready():
	# Called every time the node is added to the scene.
	# Initialization here
	set_process_input(true)
	connect("enter_hit", get_node("/root/Container/Display"), "display_input")
	
func _input(event):
	if (event.type == InputEvent.KEY):
		if event.scancode == KEY_RETURN:
			emit_signal("enter_hit", get_text())
			get_tree().set_input_as_handled()
			clear()
```

5) Attach the following script to Display:

```
extends Label

var display_text

func _ready():
    display_text = ""

func display_input(text):
    display_text = text
    set_text(display_text)
```

**Issue description:**

Expected behaviour: every time you hit the return key after typing something into the InputBar, InputBar should be cleared of any text, and that text should instead be displayed in Display. 

What happens instead is that the text passed to Display is only momentarily displayed, before disappearing. It seems the issue is the call to `clear()` in InputBar's `_input()` function. If that call is commented out, then things behave as expected BUT InputBar's text is not cleared out after hitting Enter. 

Replacing `clear()` with `set_text("")` does not fix the issue (the same thing happens). 

Assuming that this is because of some issue due to passing-by-reference when there should be a pass-by-copy, I tried replacing `emit_signal("enter_hit", get_text())` with `emit_signal("enter_hit", String(get_text()))` and `emit_signal("enter_hit", str(get_text()))`, with no success.

**Link to minimal example project:**

https://github.com/bmer/godot-string-issue/archive/master.zip

data.title: Godot Engine icon on Steam is only 32x32px
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
2.1.3 Steam Release


**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
Very low definition of icon, appearing very blurry on windows desktops.
![](http://i.imgur.com/ijpYSw9.png)

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create Godot Engine shortcut from Steam client menus.


**Link to minimal example project:**
Icon stored here
`C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steam\games\557bb7b58ccc28fd9e617f4ba49190acf3211480.ico`

**Fix:**
Use a 256x256 version.

data.title: Fixes method bind (Curve)
Better user experience with external text editors.
data.body:
* Implements `open_in_external_editor` for sub-classes of ScriptLanguage.
* Fix editor crash when editor startup with external editor enabled.
* Add option 'Debug with external editor' to debug menu to control the behavoir of script opened by editor.
* Breakpoints will open external editor to the line if `'Debug with external editor'` is enabled and the external text editor support that.

This PR should close #9205

data.title: RemoteTransform and RemoteTransform2D enhancements
data.body:
Added the following features to RemoteTransform and RemoteTransform2D:
- Added the ability to toggle changes in position, rotation, and scale
- Added the ability to toggle changes in either local or global coordinates

closes #265

data.title: Shader doesn't appear to be taking input from inspector correctly.
data.body:
In the below example, I am setting the Modulate to 1.0, 0.0, 0,0, 0,0. With the expecation that my mesh will be red.  However, the shader appears to be taking the input vectors x (or red) component and applying it to both the red and blue components of the uniform variable.

![capture3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7462993/27512431-dfd8259a-5904-11e7-90f7-c3758bba1098.PNG)

![capture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7462993/27512427-d1a65d3e-5904-11e7-9ddc-1eb76aa4f27c.PNG)

By manually adjusting the code so that only the red component is used I get what I expect to see.

![capture2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7462993/27512439-47986456-5905-11e7-93ad-02e2a06a1a57.PNG)

data.title: Added 'blit_rect_mask' method
data.body:
Added a 'blit_rect_mask' method to allow blitting of parts of an image which are transparent.
I need this for erasing what's on the screen for a pixel-paint program I am working on and doing it in gdscript is very expensive.
Will add the corresponding 3.0 method shortly too.

It also incorporates #9315 bug fixes

data.title: Workaround for IME on Linux.
data.body:
X11(fixes #29):
    
        Workaround for supporting input method frameworks like SCIM,
        IBus, Fcitx, etc.
    
        The locale is set when the application starts.
    
        Workaround for input when the input context within the specified
        input method is not available.

I'm not completely sure this should exist on all types of InputEvent (since key doesn't use it AFAIK), but since the getter and setter were registered there, I guess this had to be as well.

data.title: Iterate over both keys and values of a dictionary.
data.body:
Hi ! 👋

I regularly face the situation where I want to iterate over the values of a dictionary.

```gdscript

var data = {}

for key in data:
    data[key]
```

With Python, there is a simple API for this:

```python
data.keys()
data.values()
data.items()
```

With JavaScript, too:

```javascript
for (let [key, value] of data) {
  console.log(value);
}
```

Do you think it would be useful to have these types of shortcuts ?

Have a great weekend 🎉

data.title: Thread finished signal
data.body: Instead of having to poll a thread to see if it is finished, it would be very handy to have a signal emited when the thread is finished.
